intro: Dicaryum serrulatum, commonly known as the serrated dicaryum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely serrated leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its root system is fibrous, and it produces small, oval fruits that are dispersed by wind. Dicaryum serrulatum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
